keyword: how much calories in tuna sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Tuna Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how much calories in tuna sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Tuna Sandwich?
assumptions: One sandwich with 100g canned tuna in water, 1 tbsp mayonnaise, two slices white bread, lettuce, and tomato; no cheese or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, tuna type (oil vs. water), bread, mayo amount, and add-ons. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard tuna sandwich contains about 350 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use light mayo instead of full-fat
Add one slice of cheddar cheese

faqs.q: How much calories in tuna sandwich with mayo?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a basic version with 1 tbsp mayo.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Roughly 25 g from the tuna and bread.

faqs.q: Are tuna sandwiches high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg due to canned tuna and bread; opt for low-sodium versions.

faqs.q: Calories in tuna sandwich without bread?
faqs.a: Tuna salad alone (100g tuna + mayo) is about 200 kcal.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Use Greek yogurt instead of mayo, skip extras, and choose whole grain bread for fiber.
